report_title: Glasses and Contacts Wholesaling Industry Report
executive_summary: The Glasses and Contacts Wholesaling industry distributes prescription and nonprescription eyewear, optometric equipment and supplies to ophthalmologists, optometrists and opticians. Prior to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, a healthy economy supported industry revenue growth. However, demand for industry products has decreased significantly due to the pandemic. Despite this setback, industry revenue has increased an annualized 0.3% to $15.2 billion while entering 203, including no change in revenue (0.0%) in 2023 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A Growing Demand for Eye Care Supports Wholesalers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Increasing health spending in recent years has translated into higher demand for eyeglasses and contact lenses. This has contributed to the revenue growth for the Glasses and Contacts Wholesaling industry because they are a key player in the supply chain.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: While eyeglasses are a necessary health expense, they're also a personal spending choice
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Eyeglass wearers reflect their style and taste through their frames. Rising incomes in recent years have supported shoppers' decision to invest in designer frames or high-quality lenses, strengthening wholesale eyewear sales.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A slowdown in income growth and consumer spending after two years of strong performance following the pandemic will limit what consumers spend on new eyewear in 2024
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Downstream markets will adjust to the shift in consumer behavior by reducing their sales to wholesalers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Accelerating Online Eyewear Sales Introduce a New Challenge
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Online eyewear sales weren't anything new before 2020, but store closures and safety concerns pushed more people to online platforms than ever before. While online eyewear sales can benefit wholesalers, eyeglass manufacturers increasingly connect directly to consumers, bypassing the middleman.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Inflation Pressures Wholesalers to Raise Prices
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The unprecedented disruption to healthcare in 2020 created significant backlogs of care, renewing healthcare spending between 2021 and 2023. Pent-up demand for eye exams reinvigorated inventory spending from optometry providers, the industry's single-largest market, contributing to the strong recovery in wholesale revenue in 2021.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Growing Need for Eye Care Will Benefit Glasses and Contact Lens Suppliers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Optometry practices will remain the single-largest downstream market for wholesalers moving forward. Rising demand for optometrists from a growing number of adults 65 and over and rising incomes will translate to higher spending on wholesale glasses and contact lenses.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Healthy Online Optical Market Will Threaten Wholesale
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Online eyewear sales peaked during the pandemic but will continue growing steadily moving forward. In an online optical market, glasses manufacturers can connect directly with consumers and bypass the wholesaler, introducing a threat to the industry.

Other popular glasses manufacturers, like Zenni and Warby Parker, with direct-to-consumer channels, provide convenient online shopping experiences with innovative features combined with trendy frames at various price points. Competing with this level of convenience and customization will be challenging, disrupting the traditional optical supply chain.

To mitigate these risks, optical wholesalers must adapt their business models. Investing in e-commerce capabilities, enhancing product offerings and exploring partnerships with online retailers could help wholesalers remain competitive in the evolving eyewear market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Tech advances will characterize the optical supply chain
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The most competitive glasses and contact lens wholesalers get downstream buyers the right products when they need them. Moving forward, tech advances and AI will make wholesalers more efficient at achieving this.

industry_definition: Glasses and contacts wholesalers sell eyeglasses, contact lenses, sunglasses, eyeglass frames and reading glasses to eye care professionals and retailers. This industry also includes distributors that resell professional equipment and instruments.

opportunities: Number of adults aged 50 and older

key_trends: Economic and demographic trends are influencing eyewear sales.
Rising incomes and a growing number of adults 65 and older are behind rising spending on eyeglasses, strengthening wholesale sales.

Direct-to-consumer eyeglass sales are quickly shaking up competitive dynamics. Online eyewear sales have settled from their pandemic high but have permanently shifted how consumers shop for glasses. Ordering glasses directly from the manufacturers bypasses the wholesaler, introducing a growing threat.
Eyeglasses and contact lenses are regulated as medical devices. Wholesalers must adhere to FDA regulations regarding the distribution of any eyeglass frames, prescription lenses or contacts.

Eyeglass wholesalers receive little public or private assistance. While direct forms of assistance are limited, trade associations like The Vision Council represent the interests of the entire optical industry.
Sales of prescription glasses are wholesaler's largest revenue source. Prescription glasses correct vision impairment for nearly 200 million Americans, explaining their steep contribution to revenue.
Independent optometry providers remain glasses wholesaler's primary downstream market. A consistent, stable demand for a variety of eyewear products keeps sales high from these buyers.

Distribution networks near downstream markets lower transportation costs and shorten turnaround times. Proximity to downstream buyers makes wholesalers more responsive, supporting quicker product delivery and stronger customer relationships.
Areas with denser populations have higher concentrations of wholesalers. The distribution of glasses wholesalers across the US closely follows population trends.
Shifting competitive dynamics are creating a more challenging environment. Manufacturers with direct-to-consumer channels and online eyewear sales are bypassing the wholesaler.

Establishing a strong value proposition can help wholesalers corner a piece of the massive eyewear market. Catering to a specific downstream market through price, service or product selection can keep wholesalers competitive.
EssilorLuxottica is the global leader in eyewear. The company's vertical integration and global scale make it challenging for other wholesalers to compete.

Diverse downstream markets keep the remaining industry fragmented. Optometrists, optical chains and retailers source eyeglasses for various prices, preferences and lifestyles, supporting a mix of smaller, independent wholesalers.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Independent optometry practices are the largest market segment, relying on wholesalers for inventory.
Many chain optical retailers have expanded online operations, creating demand from wholesalers.
Mass merchandisers have increased their share of the vision care market due to bulk purchasing power.
Other downstream buyers make up a small portion of the market.
E-tailers have become an increasingly popular channel, driving demand from wholesalers.
Optical centers in department stores have decreased as a market segment.

products_and_services.product_description: Prescription eyeglasses are a major product sold by glasses and contact lens wholesalers.
Contact lenses are a significant product category for the industry.
Non-prescription eyeglasses and sunglasses are sold by wholesalers.
Ophthalmic goods like spectacles, sunglasses, frames and reading glasses make up a sizable portion of revenue.
Some wholesalers resell used optometric equipment to independent practices.
Other products and services make up a small portion of industry revenue.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Patients need a prescription from an optometrist to purchase prescription contact lenses and glasses. Rising demand for optometric care encourages optometry practices to order more glasses from wholesalers to meet demand.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region contains the largest number of industry establishments due to manufacturing operations and distribution hubs.
The West region has a sense of innovation with technology hubs like Silicon Valley.
The Mid-Atlantic has large metropolitan areas like New York City which are desirable markets for eyewear retailers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: All items distributed by the wholesale market for glasses and contacts are regarded as medical devices. Due to this classification, the US Food and Drug Administration has strict regulations regarding these goods.

In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, health and safety regulations were created in 2020. According to these recommendations, facilities should maintain extra sanitation measures and temporarily distance themselves from one another.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The wholesale industry involves the distribution of goods from manufacturers to retailers, so the labor intensity may be lower compared with the manufacturing stage.

basis_points.basis_description: Shifting competitive dynamics are creating a more challenging environment. Manufacturers with direct-to-consumer channels and online eyewear sales are bypassing the wholesaler.
Establishing a strong value proposition can help wholesalers corner a piece of the massive eyewear market.
Catering to a specific downstream market through price, service, or product selection can keep wholesalers competitive.

concentration_points.concentration_title: EssilorLuxottica controls the optical supply chain
concentration_points.concentration_description: EssilorLuxottica is the largest eyewear wholesaler in the US. The company's vertical integration contributes to its leading position in the industry – EssilorLuxottica controls everything from the distribution to the production of its lenses and frames.
The company's ownership of popular eyewear brands like RayBan and Oakley also maintains its strong position in the wholesale market.
EssilorLuxottica controls over a quarter of the US wholesale eyeglass market.

concentration_points.concentration_title: EssilorLuxottica is the largest global distributor
concentration_points.concentration_description: EssilorLuxottica is also the largest eyewear distributor globally. An extensive global network of distribution centers and retail outlets enables them to supply large volumes of eyewear products efficiently.
Fragmentation characterizes the remainder of the industry. Eyeglass and contact lens wholesalers supply eyewear to diverse downstream consumers with varying preferences, needs and budgets.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Prioritizing Inventory Management Helps Manage Steep Purchasing Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases are the single-largest expense for glasses and contacts wholesalers. Huge, ongoing inventory requirements necessitate the steep purchasing expenses.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Changing Labor Needs Influence Wage Expenses
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: What wholesalers' spend on wages annually has been falling since the pandemic. Many glasses and contact lens wholesalers had to adjust labor requirements in 2020, but many haven't reverted to pre-pandemic employment levels, leading wage costs to fall in recent years.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Strengthening Eyewear Sales Support Profit Growth
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: A drop in eyewear sales during the pandemic pushed downstream buyers to cut their inventories as demand fell, weakening profit for wholesalers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The wholesale industry involves the distribution of goods from manufacturers to retailers.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The labor intensity may be lower compared with the manufacturing stage.
Wholesalers have provided a large selection of glasses To satisfy the growing downstream demand for customizable eyewear.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Ophthalmic Goods Are a Significant Part of the Industry's Revenue Stream
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Contact lenses and glasses in the US comprise can support a vast volume of eyewear products.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The Industry Includes Reselling Professional Equipment and Instruments
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Some independent practices have continued to favor buying used equipment from wholesalers.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Eyeglass spending is sensitive to economic conditions
volatility_points.volatility_description: Consumers adjust retail spending based on changes in economic conditions.
Adapting to changing market dynamics can introduce challenges for wholesalers.

FAQs.question: How do you identify and reach out to potential new clients to expand your customer base and increase sales?
FAQs.answer: Increasing market share requires actively prospecting and engaging new clients in a competitive industry.

FAQs.question: How do you differentiate your wholesale glasses offerings through marketing campaigns and branding strategies to attract and retain customers?
FAQs.answer: A strong brand and effective marketing play a crucial role in capturing and retaining customers.
